hypothesis_content.title: Neutral Regime Volatility Compression Breakout Fade
hypothesis_content.statement: In a NEUTRAL regime (confidence >55%), when BTC experiences a sharp, high-volume breakout (>1.5x 20-day average volume) that pushes price >5% beyond the upper Bollinger Band (20,2), a contrarian short position will be profitable as the move is likely a false breakout/liquidity grab, with price reverting to the mean within 5 trading days.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Neutral regimes are characterized by range-bound action and low directional conviction. A sharp, high-volume move to an extreme is often unsustainable and designed to trigger stop-orders and FOMO, providing a high-probability mean reversion opportunity.
entry_conditions: BTC has a daily close >5% above the upper Bollinger Band (20,2)
Daily volume is >150% of the 20-day average volume
The daily candle has a long upper wick (>33% of the candle range)

exit_conditions.take_profit: Price returns to touch the 20-day SMA OR a 6% profit from entry
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price makes a new 3-day high above the entry candle's high

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: If more than 55% of such signals lead to a continuation of the trend (price remains above upper BB after 5 days) instead of a reversion.
